publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2515 Murdo Fraser: Profits of Royal Bank of Scotland Group and HBOS plc—That the Parliament congratulates the Royal Bank of Scotland Group and HBOS plc on achieving year-end profits of £8.1 billion and £4.5 billion respectively, substantially up on last year; welcomes this improved performance by two major Scottish-headquartered companies who make such a major contribution to the Scottish economy; notes that management and employees will benefit from these successes, as will HM Treasury from the substantial sums of corporation tax to be paid; further notes that the companies’ shareholders will benefit and this will include, in particular, institutional shareholders such as pension funds and, as a result, millions of people up and down the country, and believes that all of Scotland should unreservedly celebrate these Scottish success stories. Supported by: Alex Johnstone*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr David Davidson*, Mary Scanlon*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S2M-2515 Profits of Royal Bank of Scotland Group and HBOS plc (lodged on 2 March 2005) John Scott*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S2M-2515 Murdo Fraser: Profits of Royal Bank of Scotland Group and HBOS plc—That the Parliament congratulates the Royal Bank of Scotland Group and HBOS plc on achieving year-end profits of £8.1 billion and £4.5 billion respectively, substantially up on last year; welcomes this improved performance by two major Scottish-headquartered companies who make such a major contribution to the Scottish economy; notes that management and employees will benefit from these successes, as will HM Treasury from the substantial sums of corporation tax to be paid; further notes that the companies’ shareholders will benefit and this will include, in particular, institutional shareholders such as pension funds and, as a result, millions of people up and down the country, and believes that all of Scotland should unreservedly celebrate these Scottish success stories. Supported by: Alex Johnstone, Nora Radcliffe, Mr David Davidson, Mary Scanlon, Mr Jamie McGrigor, John Scott, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Bill Aitken*, Jim Mather*
S2M-2515 Profits of Royal Bank of Scotland Group and HBOS plc (lodged on 2 March 2005) Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-2515 Profits of Royal Bank of Scotland Group and HBOS plc (lodged on 2 March 2005) Donald Gorrie*
